page.title: 07Redlynch School in the Past
page.content: People who used to come our school have told us about the history of our school and what their schooldays were like. The first school was a thatched building dating from 1838.It was replaced in 1878 .This changed over the years and in 1965 the school was enlarged to three classrooms.In 1970 the field behind the school was bought to make a large playing field. A villager who started in 1915 remembers that the headmaster was the village scribe.The boys at that time wore Norfolk suits and Eton collars with bow ties.The girls wore black stockings and boots.They wore pinafores over their thick frocks. The lessons were arithmetic, reading,history,geography,writng drawing and religious instruction.
